sections.name: Programming & Technology
sections.description: Mixed question types about programming and technology

question_text: Which programming language is primarily used for web frontend development?
questions.reasoning: JavaScript is the primary language for client-side web development, running in browsers to create interactive user interfaces.

question_text: Read the statement below carefully and determine its accuracy.
STATEMENT
Based on your knowledge of Python programming language, evaluate the statement.

statements.label: Statement
statements.text: Python is an interpreted programming language that supports object-oriented programming.

questions.reasoning: Python is indeed an interpreted language and fully supports object-oriented programming paradigms.

question_text: Review the following statements about Git version control system.
LIST
Select the option that identifies all the correct statements.
list_items: i. Git is a distributed version control system
ii. Git was created by Linus Torvalds
iii. Git requires a central server to function
iv. Git can track changes in binary files
questions.reasoning: Git is distributed (i), created by Linus Torvalds (ii), does NOT require a central server (iii is false), and can track binary files (iv).

question_text: Match each programming language with its primary use case.
MTF_DATA
How many of the following programming languages are correctly matched with their primary use?
questions.reasoning: All three languages are correctly matched with their primary use cases.

question_text: Consider the following statements about artificial intelligence and machine learning.
STATEMENTS
Evaluate the relationship between these statements.

statements.label: Statement-1
statements.text: Machine Learning is a subset of Artificial Intelligence.

statements.label: Statement-2
statements.text: Deep Learning is a subset of Machine Learning that uses neural networks.

choices: Both statements are true and Statement-2 explains Statement-1
Both statements are true but Statement-2 does not explain Statement-1
Statement-1 is true but Statement-2 is false
questions.answer: Both statements are true but Statement-2 does not explain Statement-1
questions.reasoning: Both statements are factually correct, but Statement-2 about Deep Learning doesn't explain the relationship between ML and AI mentioned in Statement-1.

question_text: Consider the standard software development lifecycle (SDLC) phases listed below.
LIST
What is the correct sequence for these software development lifecycle phases?
questions.reasoning: The standard SDLC follows: Requirements Analysis → Design → Implementation → Testing → Deployment.

question_text: PARAGRAPH
According to the paragraph, which type of machine learning uses labeled data?
questions.paragraph: Machine Learning is a subset of Artificial Intelligence that enables computers to learn and make decisions without being explicitly programmed. It uses algorithms to analyze data, identify patterns, and make predictions. There are three main types: supervised learning (using labeled data), unsupervised learning (finding patterns in unlabeled data), and reinforcement learning (learning through trial and error with rewards).
questions.reasoning: The paragraph explicitly states that supervised learning uses labeled data.

sections.name: Geography & World Knowledge
sections.description: Mixed question types about geography and world knowledge

question_text: Consider the different continents and their geographical sizes.
Which is the largest continent by area?
questions.reasoning: Asia is the largest continent, covering about 30% of Earth's total land area and containing about 60% of the world's population.

question_text: Consider the geographic facts about major world rivers.
STATEMENT
Analyze the accuracy of the following statement about the Amazon River.

statements.label: Statement
statements.text: The Amazon River is the longest river in the world and flows through Brazil, Peru, and Colombia.

questions.reasoning: While the Amazon does flow through Brazil, Peru, and Colombia, the Nile River is generally considered the longest river in the world.

question_text: Examine the following facts about the Sahara Desert.
LIST
Which of the following statements about the Sahara Desert are correct?
list_items: i. It is the largest hot desert in the world
ii. It covers parts of 11 countries
iii. It is larger than the United States
iv. It receives no rainfall throughout the year
questions.reasoning: The Sahara is the largest hot desert (i), covers 11 countries (ii), is larger than the US (iii), but does receive some rainfall (iv is false).

question_text: Analyze the following statements about global climate patterns.
STATEMENTS
Determine the correctness of the assertion and reasoning.

statements.label: Assertion
statements.text: The equatorial regions receive more solar radiation than the polar regions.

statements.label: Reasoning
statements.text: The sun's rays hit the equatorial regions more directly while hitting the polar regions at an oblique angle.

choices: Both assertion and reasoning are correct, and reasoning explains the assertion
Both assertion and reasoning are correct, but reasoning does not explain the assertion
Assertion is correct but reasoning is incorrect
Both assertion and reasoning are incorrect
questions.answer: Both assertion and reasoning are correct, and reasoning explains the assertion
questions.reasoning: The assertion is true - equatorial regions do receive more solar radiation. The reasoning correctly explains why this happens - direct vs oblique angle of sunlight.

question_text: Test your knowledge of world capitals by matching countries with their capital cities.
MTF_DATA
How many of the following countries are correctly matched with their capitals?
questions.reasoning: France-Paris (correct), Japan-Beijing (incorrect, should be Tokyo), Australia-Canberra (correct), Brazil-Brasília (correct).

question_text: Consider the lengths of these major world rivers.
LIST
What is the correct sequence of these rivers from longest to shortest?
questions.reasoning: From longest to shortest: Nile (6,650 km) → Amazon (6,400 km) → Yangtze (6,300 km) → Mississippi (3,730 km).

question_text: Study the following information about climate change and its causes.
PARAGRAPH
According to the paragraph, what has been the dominant driver of climate change since the mid-20th century?
questions.paragraph: Climate change refers to long-term shifts in global temperatures and weather patterns. While climate variations are natural, scientific evidence shows that human activities, particularly the emission of greenhouse gases like carbon dioxide from burning fossil fuels, have been the dominant driver of climate change since the mid-20th century. The effects include rising sea levels, more frequent extreme weather events, and changes in precipitation patterns.
questions.reasoning: The paragraph explicitly states that human activities, particularly greenhouse gas emissions from burning fossil fuels, have been the dominant driver since the mid-20th century.

sections.name: Science & Chemistry
sections.description: Mixed question types about science and chemistry

question_text: Think about the basic chemical compounds you encounter daily.
What is the chemical formula for water?
questions.reasoning: Water is composed of two hydrogen atoms bonded to one oxygen atom, giving it the molecular formula H2O.

question_text: Consider the electronic configuration and chemical behavior of noble gases.
STATEMENT
Evaluate the following statement about noble gas reactivity.

statements.label: Statement
statements.text: Noble gases are chemically inert because they have complete outer electron shells.

questions.reasoning: Noble gases are indeed chemically inert under normal conditions due to their complete outer electron shells, making them stable.

question_text: Review the following facts about the photosynthesis process in plants.
LIST
Which of the following statements about photosynthesis are correct?
list_items: i. It occurs in the chloroplasts of plant cells
ii. It converts carbon dioxide and water into glucose
iii. It requires sunlight as an energy source
iv. It produces oxygen as a byproduct
questions.reasoning: All statements about photosynthesis are correct: it occurs in chloroplasts (i), converts CO2 and water to glucose (ii), requires sunlight (iii), and produces oxygen (iv).

question_text: Test your knowledge of chemical element symbols.
MTF_DATA
How many of the following elements are correctly matched with their chemical symbols?
questions.reasoning: All elements are correctly matched: Gold-Au, Silver-Ag, Iron-Fe, Copper-Cu, Lead-Pb.

question_text: Recall the ordered stages of cell division during mitosis.
LIST
What is the correct sequence of phases in mitosis?
questions.reasoning: Mitosis follows the sequence: Prophase → Metaphase → Anaphase → Telophase (PMAT).

question_text: Evaluate the following statements about chemical bonding and molecular structure.
STATEMENTS
Assess the logical relationship between assertion, reasoning, and inference.

statements.label: Assertion
statements.text: Covalent bonds are stronger than ionic bonds in most cases.

statements.label: Reasoning
statements.text: Covalent bonds involve direct sharing of electrons between atoms, creating stronger attractions.

statements.label: Inference
statements.text: Therefore, covalent compounds have higher melting points than ionic compounds.

choices: Assertion and reasoning are correct, but inference is incorrect
Assertion is correct, reasoning and inference are incorrect
All three statements are correct and logically connected
questions.answer: Assertion and reasoning are correct, but inference is incorrect
questions.reasoning: While covalent bonds are often stronger than ionic bonds (assertion correct) due to electron sharing (reasoning correct), ionic compounds typically have higher melting points due to their crystal lattice structure (inference incorrect).

question_text: Learn about the organization and patterns in the periodic table.
PARAGRAPH
According to the paragraph, why do elements in the same group have similar chemical properties?
questions.paragraph: The periodic table organizes chemical elements by their atomic number, which represents the number of protons in an atom's nucleus. Elements in the same vertical column (group) have similar chemical properties because they have the same number of valence electrons. Elements in the same horizontal row (period) have the same number of electron shells. The periodic table helps predict an element's properties based on its position.
choices: They have the same atomic number
They have the same number of valence electrons
They have the same number of electron shells
They have the same atomic mass
questions.answer: They have the same number of valence electrons
questions.reasoning: The paragraph explicitly states that elements in the same group have similar properties because they have the same number of valence electrons.
